glsa.title: JabberD 2.x: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Gentoo's JabberD 2.x ebuild, the worst of which allows local attackers to escalate privileges.

background.p: JabberD 2.x is an open source Jabber server written in C.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Gentooâ€™s JabberD 2.x ebuild. Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

impact.p: An attacker could possibly escalate privileges by owning system binaries in trusted locations, cause a Denial of Service condition by manipulating the PID file from jabberd2 services, bypass security via SASL ANONYMOUS connections or have other unspecified impacts.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: Gentoo has discontinued support for JabberD 2.x and recommends that users unmerge the package:
As an alternative, users may want to upgrade their systems to use net-im/prosody instead of net-im/jabberd2.
